duties_responsibilities.duty: Research and analyze complex information to resolve errors, modify data, and administer fiscal aspects of grant(s).
Prepare and analyze fiscal and budgetary documentation, reports, and records using Ohio Administrative Knowledge System (OAKS) and agency fiscal databases.
Monitor, analyze, and approve accounting transactions and reconcile expenditures of state, federal, and private funds.
Develop and implement fiscal policies/procedures relative to federal/state grant guidelines.
Assist grant project managers and develop ledgers to track state, federal, and private funds expenditures.
Review and approve Notice of Awards and ensure funds unexpended by sub-recipients are returned to the department or grantor.
Perform miscellaneous tasks, including maintaining records, preparing documents, attending meetings, and providing cross-training to unit staff.

education_certification.credential: Completion of graduate core program in business administration, accounting, finance or related field; 6 months of experience or training in accounting and/or finance to include an advanced level of experience in spreadsheet software.

OR completion of undergraduate core program in business administration, accounting, finance or related field; 18 months of experience or training in accounting and/or finance to include an advanced level of experience in spreadsheet software.
OR 42 months of experience or training in accounting and/or finance to include an advanced level of experience in spreadsheet software.
OR 12 months of experience as Financial Analyst.
OR successful completion of the Fiscal Academy may be substituted for 4 months of required accounting/fiscal experience.
